meanings.definition: A short article or section in a newspaper or magazine, typically placed alongside the main text.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper had interesting sidebars about local events.
meanings.sent2: I always enjoy reading the sidebars in magazines for extra information.
meanings.sent3: The sidebar about funny cat videos made me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her life was like a sidebar in a magazine, full of unexpected twists.
meanings.sent5: The sidebar on healthy eating tips was so helpful and easy to remember.

meanings.definition: A secondary or incidental issue or topic.
meanings.sent1: The main focus of the meeting was the budget, but they also discussed sidebars like office decor.
meanings.sent2: Let's not forget the sidebars like team morale when planning the project.
meanings.sent3: The sidebar on office snacks brought some unexpected laughter to the meeting.
meanings.sent4: In life, love is the main story, and everything else is just a sidebar.
meanings.sent5: The sidebar on time management was a game-changer for my productivity.
